Plot: Birth: it's a miracle. A rite of passage. A natural part of life. But more than anything, birth is a business. Compelled to find answers after a disappointing birth experience with her ...
Title: The Business of Being Born
Actors: Mary Helen Ayres, Julia Barnett, Sylvie Blaustein, Louann Brizendine
tomatoConsensus: Epstein's argument in favor of home birthing is certainly biased -- but its biases are so transparent, and so impassioned, that they work in the film's favor.
